thread.title: Oologah defense dominates Cascia Hall in 43-7 rout
thread.title_full: Oologah defense dominates Cascia Hall in 43-7 rout

title: Oologah defense dominates Cascia Hall in 43-7 rout
text:
Oologah defense dominates Cascia Hall in 43-7 rout Sponsored Links By Jon Potts, World Correspondent 
Fourth-ranked Oologah used a great team effort in a 43-7 victory sixth-ranked Cascia Hall in a key district 4A-3 game Friday night at Father Hamill Field's Ray Siegfried II Stadium. 
The Mustangs (4-2, 2-1) were dominant on defense. They forced five turnovers, registered five sacks, and held the Commandos (3-3, 1-2) to just 112 yards. 
"We knew going into the season we had an outstanding defense," Oologah head coach Brandon Craig said. "We've had a lot of injuries. It felt good to get some guys back tonight." 
The Oologah offense wasn't too shabby either. Quarterback Casey Base passed for 245 yards and three touchdowns. Sign up for our FOX23 News This Morning Newsletter Sign Up
